00046 #ifndef __CVMX_ADMA_H__
00047 #define __CVMX_ADMA_H__
00048 
00049 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00050 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00051 extern "C" {
00052 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00053 #endif
00054 
00055 /*
00056  * PHY memory ranges
00057  */
00058 #define CVMX_BBP_PHY_SMEM_SIZE  (438 * 1024)
00059 #define CVMX_BBP_PHY_DMEM_SIZE  (384 * 1024)
00060 #define CVMX_BBP_PHY_IMEM_SIZE  (256 * 1024)
00061 
00062 #define CVMX_BBP_PHY_SMEM0_BASE 0x900000
00063 #define CVMX_BBP_PHY_SMEM0_SIZE CVMX_BBP_PHY_SMEM_SIZE
00064 #define CVMX_BBP_PHY_DMEM0_BASE 0x9A0000
00065 #define CVMX_BBP_PHY_DMEM0_SIZE CVMX_BBP_PHY_DMEM_SIZE
00066 #define CVMX_BBP_PHY_IMEM0_BASE 0x100000
00067 #define CVMX_BBP_PHY_IMEM0_SIZE CVMX_BBP_PHY_IMEM_SIZE
00068 
00069 #define CVMX_BBP_PHY_SMEM1_BASE 0xA00000
00070 #define CVMX_BBP_PHY_SMEM1_SIZE CVMX_BBP_PHY_SMEM_SIZE
00071 #define CVMX_BBP_PHY_DMEM1_BASE 0xAA0000
00072 #define CVMX_BBP_PHY_DMEM1_SIZE CVMX_BBP_PHY_DMEM_SIZE
00073 #define CVMX_BBP_PHY_IMEM1_BASE 0x200000
00074 #define CVMX_BBP_PHY_IMEM1_SIZE CVMX_BBP_PHY_IMEM_SIZE
00075 
00076 #define CVMX_BBP_PHY_SMEM2_BASE 0xB00000
00077 #define CVMX_BBP_PHY_SMEM2_SIZE CVMX_BBP_PHY_SMEM_SIZE
00078 #define CVMX_BBP_PHY_DMEM2_BASE 0xBA0000
00079 #define CVMX_BBP_PHY_DMEM2_SIZE CVMX_BBP_PHY_DMEM_SIZE
00080 #define CVMX_BBP_PHY_IMEM2_BASE 0x300000
00081 #define CVMX_BBP_PHY_IMEM2_SIZE CVMX_BBP_PHY_IMEM_SIZE
00082 
00083 /*
00084  * flags for cvmx_bbp_adma_init()
00085  */
00086 #define CVMX_ADMA_INIT_DEFAULT      0x0
00087 #define CVMX_ADMA_INIT_IMEM_PARITY_ENB  0x1
00088 
00089 /*
00090  * AXI DMA channels
00091  */
00092 #define CVMX_ADMA_CHAN_WR1  0
00093 #define CVMX_ADMA_CHAN_RD1  1
00094 #define CVMX_ADMA_CHAN_WR2  2
00095 #define CVMX_ADMA_CHAN_RD2  3
00096 #define CVMX_ADMA_CHAN_WR3  4
00097 #define CVMX_ADMA_CHAN_RD3  5
00098 #define CVMX_ADMA_CHAN_WR4  6
00099 #define CVMX_ADMA_CHAN_RD4  7
00100 
00101 /*
00102  * AXI bus max_burst
00103  * 0 for 8 doublewords and 1 for 16.
00104  */
00105 #define CVMX_ADMA_MAX_BURST8    0
00106 #define CVMX_ADMA_MAX_BURST16   1
00107 
00108 /*
00109  * Return values for cvmx_adma_io()
00110  */
00111 #define CVMX_ADMA_IO_SUCCESS     0
00112 #define CVMX_ADMA_IO_TIMEOUT    -1  /* timeout for polling */
00113 #define CVMX_ADMA_IO_BUSY       -2  /* ADMA channel busy. */
00114 #define CVMX_ADMA_IO_UNAVAIL    -3  /* This could be because of
00115                      * - invalid parameter(s),
00116                      * - invalid parameter(s) that lead
00117                      *   to operation out of range, or
00118                      * - DMA from I/DMEM to host
00119                      *   not allowed.
00120                      * See __cvmx_validate_adma_params()
00121                      * for details.
00122                      */
00123 #define CVMX_ADMA_IO_AXI_ERR    -4  /* AXI error. */
00124 
00125 /*
00126  * Perform an AXI DMA operation.
00127  *
00128  * @param buffer is the 64-bit address of the buffer in the DMA host's RAM.
00129  * @param phy_addr is the 32-bit address of the HAB Memory Manager(HMM).
00130  * @param num_bytes is the number of bytes to transfer.
00131  * @param channel identifies the DMA channel (CVMX_ADMA_CHAN_XXX) for the
00132  *     transfer.
00133  * @param max_burst is the maximum burst length attempted on the AXI bus,
00134  *     CVMX_ADMA_MAX_BURST8 or CVMX_ADMA_MAX_BURST16.
00135  * @param use_word_xfer_mode with a non-zero value indicates that the
00136  *     ``word transfer mode'' should be used for the transaction.
00137  * @param timeout indicates the amount of polling to be done to check for
00138  *     the ADMA results.
00139  *     - timeout == 0 means immediately return after initiating the ADMA
00140  *       transaction.
00141  *     - timeout > 0 is the maximum number of milliseconds to poll.
00142  *     - timeout < 0 means the function should poll indefinitely for the
00143  *       completion of the transaction.
00144  *
00145  * @return 0 for success and a negative value for failure.
00146  */
00147 extern int cvmx_adma_io(void *buffer, uint32_t phy_addr, int num_bytes, int channel, int max_burst, int use_word_xfer_mode, int timeout);
00148 
00149 /*
00150  * A wrapper over cvmx_adma_io() to transfer data from host to the
00151  * Endor PHY
00152  */
00153 static inline int cvmx_adma_host2bbp(void *buffer, uint32_t phy_addr, int num_bytes, int max_burst, int use_word_xfer_mode, int timeout)
00154 {
00155     int tile, channel;
00156 
00157     /* derive the read channel from phy_addr */
00158     tile = phy_addr >> 20;
00159     tile = (tile > 8) ? tile - 9 : tile - 1;
00160     channel = tile * 2 + 1;
00161 
00162     return cvmx_adma_io(buffer, channel, phy_addr, num_bytes, max_burst, use_word_xfer_mode, timeout);
00163 }
00164 
00165 /*
00166  * A wrapper over cvmx_adma_io() to transfer data the Endor PHY to
00167  * host
00168  */
00169 static inline int cvmx_adma_bbp2host(void *buffer, uint32_t phy_addr, int num_bytes, int max_burst, int use_word_xfer_mode, int timeout)
00170 {
00171     int tile, channel;
00172 
00173     /* derive the write channel from phy_addr */
00174     tile = phy_addr >> 20;
00175     tile = (tile > 8) ? tile - 9 : tile - 1;
00176     channel = tile * 2;
00177 
00178     return cvmx_adma_io(buffer, channel, phy_addr, num_bytes, max_burst, use_word_xfer_mode, timeout);
00179 }
00180 
00181 /*
00182  * Pull the DSPS into reset, enable the clocks, set stall state.
00183  *
00184  * @param tile is 0, 1, or 2 for tile RX0, RX1, and TX, respectively.
00185  */
00186 extern void cvmx_bbp_reset_dsps(int tile);
00187 
00188 /*
00189  * Release the DSPs from reset,.
00190  *
00191  * @param tile is 0, 1, or 2 for tile RX0, RX1, and TX, respectively.
00192  */
00193 extern void cvmx_bbp_release_dsps(int tile);
00194 
00195 /*
00196  * Set dsp stall state.
00197  *
00198  * @param tile is 0, 1, or 2 for tile RX0, RX1, and TX, respectively.
00199  * @param dsp is 0 for dsp0, 1 for dsp1, and 2 for both.
00200  */
00201 extern void cvmx_bbp_stall_dsps(int tile, int dsp);
00202 
00203 /*
00204  * Clear dsp stall state
00205  *
00206  * @param tile is 0, 1, or 2 for tile RX0, RX1, and TX
00207  * @param dsp is 0 for dsp0, 1 for dsp1, and 2 for both.
00208  */
00209 extern void cvmx_bbp_unstall_dsps(int tile, int dsp);
00210 
00211 /*
00212  * Intialize the BBP PHY and the ADMA block.
00213  *
00214  * @param init_flags is a bit vector that holds init options, where the
00215  *     default is CVMX_ADMA_INIT_DEFAULT    
00216  *
00217  * @return 0 for success and a negative value for error.
00218  *
00219  * Note if the BBP PHY is not in the reset state, this funtion does
00220  * not force it.
00221  */
00222 extern int cvmx_bbp_adma_init(uint64_t init_flags);
00223 
00224 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00225 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00226 }
00227 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00228 #endif
